definition: to talk to someone in a friendly and humorous way
example: He stood around bantering with his colleagues.

definition: to be as good, impressive, etc. as sb/sth else
example: You will find scenery to rival anything you can see in the Alps.

definition: a long period when there is little or no rain
example: The drought caused serious damage to crops.

definition: extremely large
example: They were asking a colossal amount of money for the house.

definition: waver between extremes of opinion, action, or quality
example: My emotions oscillate between desperation and hope.

meaning_cn: 无法纠正的，不能恢复的，无法挽救的
definition: impossible to correct or return to a previously existing situation or condition
example: The couple separated on the grounds of irretrievable breakdown (of their marriage).

definition: to work together with sb in order to produce or achieve sth
example: Researchers around the world are collaborating to develop a new vaccine.

definition: something that is a part of your history or that remains from an earlier time
example: The war has left a legacy of hatred.

definition: the fact of continuing to try to do sth despite difficulties
example: His persistence was finally rewarded when the insurance company agreed to pay for the damage.

definition: the hard work and effort that sb puts into an activity or purpose because they think it is important
example: He has always shown great dedication to the cause.

definition: a feeling or an opinion, especially one based on emotions
example: Public sentiment is against any change to the law.

definition: a system of government by a king or a queen
example: This may seem surprising in view of the widespread acceptance of monarchy.

definition: very strong and powerful
example: He struck him with a mighty blow across his shoulder.

meaning_cn: 周围的；（尤指）周围环境条件的
definition: existing in the surrounding area
example: The liquid is stored at below ambient temperature.

definition: reckon or calculate (a figure or amount)
example: The hire charge is computed on a daily basis.

definition: to surround something
example: The park that encloses the monument has recently been enlarged.

definition: to encourage the development or growth of ideas or feelings
example: I'm trying to foster an interest in classical music in my children.

definition: the state of not agreeing or sharing opinions
example: A note of discord has crept into relations between the two countries.

meaning_cn: （贬）十足的，完全的，彻头彻尾的（表强调）
definition: utter; complete (used for emphasis)
example: The working conditions are unhealthy, if not downright dangerous.

definition: to make something less harmful, unpleasant, or bad
example: It is unclear how to mitigate the effects of tourism on the island.

definition: complete and without any doubts
example: All her life she had implicit faith in her way of life.

definition: stated clearly and in detail, leaving no room for confusion or doubt
example: The arrangement had not been made explicit.

meaning_cn: （人，话语）直率的，生硬的，耿直的
definition: uncompromisingly forthright
example: I'll be blunt - that last piece of work you did was terrible.

definition: to examine something very carefully in order to discover information
example: He scrutinized the men's faces carefully, trying to work out who was lying.

meaning_cn: （因吃惊、害怕、喜悦等而发出的）呼喊，惊叫
definition: something you say or shout suddenly because of surprise, fear, pleasure, etc.
example: Meg gave an involuntary exclamation.

definition: to know, recognize or understand sth, especially sth that is not obvious
example: It is possible to discern a number of different techniques in her work.

meaning_cn: 恳求，乞求；引起，造成，产生，唤起；援引，借助（法律）
definition: 1. call earnestly for 2. give rise to; evoke 3. to use a law in order to achieve something
example: She invoked his help against this attack.

definition: to end a connection with someone or something
example: The company has severed its ties with its previous partners.

definition: show or announce publicly for the first time
example: The company recently unveiled a test version of its new search engine.

definition: a small tool or device that does sth useful
example: They sold a variety of kitchen gadgets.

meaning_cn: 截然不同的，迥然相异的
definition: different in every way
example: The two cultures were so utterly disparate that she found it hard to adapt from one to the other.

meaning_cn: 造成，引起（尤指问题或困难）
definition: to cause something, especially a problem or difficulty
example: Nuclear weapons pose a threat to everyone.

definition: an area of interest or an area over which a person has control
example: These documents are in the public domain.

definition: relating to the chemical processes within the body required for life
example: The athletes had taken pills to stimulate their metabolic rate.

definition: refusing to change your ideas or to stop doing something
example: He's as stubborn as a mule.
